alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 6:21AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monona, Harrison and western Shelby Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 620 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Castana to 2 miles southeast of Missouri Valley. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Castana around 625 AM CDT. Logan and Soldier around 630 AM CDT. Mapleton around 635 AM CDT. Ute and Persia around 640 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Shelby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southwestern and west central Iowa.
